core_principles: Neon signals status, Darkness signals depth
Academic Rigor (Clear labels, no chart junk)

backgroundImage.grid-pattern: linear-gradient(to right, #1e293b 1px, transparent 1px), linear-gradient(to bottom, #1e293b 1px, transparent 1px)

dashboard.card_style: bg-card/50 backdrop-blur-sm border border-border/50 hover:border-primary/50 transition-colors duration-300

visual_assets.icons: Lucide React (Shield, Activity, Lock, Server, Cpu, Globe, AlertTriangle)
background_effects: Radial gradient glow behind hero elements

Home.hero: Large typing text effect (CyberSentinelle initializing...), minimalist grid background
Home.stats: Rolling number counters for 'Packets Analyzed', 'Threats Blocked'

Dashboard.layout: Sidebar navigation (collapsible), Main content area with Bento grid
Dashboard.widgets: Real-time traffic monitor (LineChart), Attack Origin (Map or List), Threat Level (Gauge)

Model.focus: Confusion Matrix heatmap (Red for False Negatives), ROC Curve

Prediction.input: Terminal-style input form or file upload drag-drop zone with scanning animation

accessibility.contrast: Ensure neon text has sufficient contrast against dark bg (use 4.5:1 ratio)

instructions_to_main_agent: Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all data values, code snippets, and terminal inputs.
Ensure the 'Download Notebook' button is prominent and labeled 'Télécharger le Notebook (FR)'.
Implement a 'Demo Mode' toggle that hides complex controls and focuses on visualizations.
Use 'sonner' for toast notifications (e.g., 'Model Training Complete', 'Intrusion Detected').
DO NOT use gradients for backgrounds. Use solid dark colors with subtle borders.
universal_guidelines: Avoid 'AI slop' aesthetics (generic centered layouts, purple/blue gradients).
Use z-index hierarchy to create depth.
Micro-animations are mandatory for all interactions.
Spacing should be generous (p-6, p-8) even in dense dashboards.
